posts.post_content: I know Red isn't really big on life gain or damage prevention, but... I think the biggest problem with this Leyline is that, unlike other Leyline cards, this card affects everyone. While other Leylines benefit only you or hurt only your opponent(s), the way this card affects all players might mean it is less likely to be useful in a deck that has more than one color.
posts.html:
I know Red isn't really big on life gain or damage prevention, but... I think the biggest problem with this Leyline is that, unlike other Leyline cards, this card affects everyone. posts.post_content:
This is the perfect answer to 1 of the few main opponents RDW has: lifegain! I've lost so many games because my opponent has something like Basalisk Collar or Transcendent Master, and I can't stop the lifegain.   
  
This card also kills most sideboard cards, which usually are creatures with Protection from \_\_\_\_\_\_, or RDW's nightmare, Korr Firewalker.

posts.post_content: If you put this leyline out and an opponent put out leyline of sanctity, which states that they have shroud, which leyline wins? They can't prevent your damage but you can't target them, which is preventing the damage?

Posted By: brothersbutler (8/31/2010 11:57:50 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Yeah, this is kinda useless. At best it stops [Ajani's Pridemate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ajani's Pridemate) and [Ajani's Mantra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ajani's Mantra), ruins [Soul Warden](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Warden), and just turns [Captured Sunlight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Captured Sunlight) into a glorified cascade opener. Then they play [Warpriest of Thune](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Warpriest of Thune) or some other come-into-play removal.  
  
Having 4 of them all begin the game in play would be quite the obstacle to any lifegain deck however. But your hand would suck at only 3 remaining cards.
posts.html:

Posted By: specter001 (9/25/2010 7:04:37 PM)

posts.post_content:
@brothersbutler:  
  
Your opponent's [Leyline of Sanctity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline of Sanctity) forbids you to even target him. This means that you can't even cast a [Fireball](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fireball) with that player among its targets. So [Leyline of Punishment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline of Punishment) does nothing in this case. **But**, it does make non-targeted spells' damage unpreventable (for example, you can cast a [Volcanic Fallout](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Volcanic Fallout) and it will deal damage and kill creatures with toughness up to 2, even if they have protection from it)
posts.html:
@brothersbutler:

Your opponent's Leyline of Sanctity forbids you to even target him. This means that you can't even cast a Fireball with that player among its targets. So Leyline of Punishment does nothing in this case. But, it does make non-targeted spells' damage unpreventable (for example, you can cast a Volcanic Fallout and it will deal damage and kill creatures with toughness up to 2, even if they have protection from it)
